frontMatter.title: Know when their information is prefilled
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to help users understand when their information is automatically populated.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern to help users understand when their information will be automatically populated, where that data originates, and how they can modify it.

when_to_use.value: **Prefilling user data.** When you prefill a user's data into an application or form.
**Editable prefilled data.** When users have the ability to update the prefilled data.
**Authenticated users only.** This pattern applies only to signed-in users.

design_principles.value: **Visibility of system status.** Communicate current state so users feel in control.
**User control and freedom.** Allow users authority over their own information.
**Clarify save location.** Indicate whether changes update VA Profile, the form only, or let users choose.

when_not_to_use.value: **Unauthenticated users.** Don't show prefilled personal information to users who aren't signed in.

examples.title: Non-editable prefilled information
examples.description: Cards without edit links for legal name, DOB, SSN with instructions for offline updates.

examples.title: Editable prefilled information
examples.description: Cards with edit links for contact details and addresses.

examples.title: Save location alert
examples.description: Alert indicating where changes will be saved.

how_to_build.intro: The pattern operates across three key scenarios for prefilled data.

steps.value: **Non-editable information:** Remove edit links from cards for legal name, DOB, SSN.
Include a bolded 'Note:' explaining how to update this information offline.
**Editable information:** Display data in cards with edit links.
**Save location clarity:** Display alerts indicating where changes are saved.
Options: update VA Profile, update form only, or let users choose via radio buttons.

content_considerations.value: Unauthenticated alert heading: 'Sign in with a verified account'
Authenticated alert heading: 'We've prefilled some of your information'
Clearly distinguish between editable and non-editable fields.

accessibility.value: Use semantic HTML (description lists, unordered lists) for uneditable information.
Edit links must be clearly labeled for screen readers.
Success alerts should confirm where changes were saved.
